metadata.title: CVE-2018-14679 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in mspack/chmd.c in libmspack before 0.7alpha.There is an off-by-one error in the CHM PMGI/PMGL chunk number validitychecks, which could lead to denial of service (uninitialized datadereference and application crash).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.100.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
clamav-base - 0.100.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
clamav-daemon - 0.100.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
clamav-freshclam - 0.100.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
clamav-milter - 0.100.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
clamav-testfiles - 0.100.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
libclamav7 - 0.100.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmspack: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.100.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.3').
